p:
The sample size for the survey population was determined using the Cochran ( 1977) equation.
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$n = \frac{{Z^{2} P\left( {1 - P} \right)}}{{C^{2} }}$$\end{document}
n =
Z 2
P
1 - P
C 2
with n = sample size; Z = confidence level; P = percentage in decimal; c = confidence interval in decimal.
